basics.name: Kouyakou-Abalo SIMSOBA
basics.summary: Google DeepMind Scholar specializing in Artificial Intelligence with research interests in robust machine learning, time series forecasting, NLP, and computer vision. Currently pursuing an M.Sc. in Artificial Intelligence for Science at AIMS South Africa.

work.summary: Developed novel hybrid Minkowski-Log-Cosh loss function for robust time-series forecasting. Applied LSTM models to predict malaria cases using 10-year public health data (2013-2023). Addressed challenges of noisy and outlier-contaminated data in epidemiological forecasting.
highlights: Developed hybrid loss function for robust LSTM forecasting
Applied models to real-world malaria incidence data
Demonstrated improved robustness over traditional methods

work.summary: Conducted research evaluating effects of online learning during COVID-19 pandemic and developed ANN models for agricultural yield prediction.
highlights: Evaluated online learning impact on student population
Designed ANN models integrating climate and soil variables
Conducted feature sensitivity analysis for predictive factors
